FuncDef: This command overrides the low queue drop tail as a percentage reduction from the MBS of the queue. For example, if a queue has an MBS of 600 kbytes and this percentage is configured to be 30% for the low drop tail, then the low drop tail is at 420 kbytes and out-of-profile packets are not accepted into the queue if its depth is greater than this value, and discarded.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the percentage reduction from the MBS for a queue drop tail. Values-0 to 100, default.
